Reviews.Title: Amature
Reviews.Author: scootertim
Reviews.Content: I have had my DMC-FZ60 for about three weeks now.  I am a Panasonic user, and have bought many of their pocket cameras for the family.  I also own a Cannon T50 SLR with three lens, some Sony's and others.  I previously owned the Panasonic FZ8, prior to getting the FZ60, which is a major upgrade in my kit.  The FZ8 has taken thousands of great pictures, and is now in the hands of my college nephew, being put to good use in the field.I have taken several sets of picture themes, Sports (football, motorcycle racing), indoor, video outdoors, scenery and sun sets.  Of the 300 plus pictures taken only four were blow due to poor focus or exposure.  I believe one was my fault, being to quick with a pan shot.The football shots were shot in good light during the day.  Exploiting the massive reach of 600 mm lens to the wide angle of the 25 mm lens created some stunning shots.  I captured burst shots from 70 yards with great clarity, also capturing a panorama of the entire field from the bleachers at mid field that was stunning and perfectly stitched together.  The 16 MP MOS sensor is a huge improvement over the 7mp I had before.  Only issue noted was the limited number of shots in burst mode.Motorcycles, at 120 MPH captured in video and stills both panning, and burst mode.  From the timing stand, taking video the auto wind cut filter removed all the ambient wind noise, leaving the throaty rasp of the Suzuki's and Ducati's.  Manual panning was good, and I think will improve as I get more comfortable with the camera.  I find the dedicated video button a welcome addition.  Only once did I hit the focus button as opposed to the video button, again muscle memory will take care of this.Indoor, what can I say, no red eye when using the program mode, or any other.  iA is also nice and in certain situations handy when people are moving about between different light sources.  Flash is very effective, much more range than my old FZ8Outdoor scenery looks like it will be fun.  With the creative mode you can easily flip to different effects.Long tele shots are superb, the only drawback here is the the slow auto focus at these insane distances.  Manual will come in handy here.I find using the menus OK, I have used them for years and they seem natural to me.  AE/AF/Lock is the only button I have not come close to mastering yet.I considered the FZ-200 but with the difference in price it was hard to justify for my amateur needs.  I have not missed RAW for my portrait pictures, the JPEG images from the FZ60 are excellent.  I usually only adjusted lighting/contrast and sharpness anyway, and the FZ60 is doing a fine job with white balance set to auto.I am very please with this camera and have recommend it to several friends.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera/Great Pictures
Reviews.Author: Big Mike
Reviews.Content: Yo-Chose this camera for it's great rating in Consumers Reports (#1 in the Super Zoom category) and the twohundred fifty pricepoint at fortysecond street photo.I almost didn't get it - instead of the Canon SX50 HS because of the Canons 50x zoom vs. the Panasonic's 24x zoom - however after finding and reading the manual on the Panasonic site - I found that there is a way to go into the EZ setting (Extra Zoom) that gives me a 60.3x zoom !!!  Then using it with a monopole - I found here on Amazon for < than twemty bucks - I am getting supurb/sharp zoomed 60.3x pictures with this camera.Unlike my Nikon D5100 and the three lenses I have bought - this gives me 95% of the features in a MUCH smaller package.Again - GREAT photos for a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ60K: Bridge Camera for the Outdoors
Reviews.Author: Randy Wakeman "Randy Wakeman"
Reviews.Content: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ60K: Bridge Camera for the OutdoorsThe FZ60 is bargain, a true bargain. It doesn't do everything, but it comes close. It isn't "the absolute best" in any one category, but it is at least "very good plus" in the categories that matter most to a lot of folks: stills, video, zoom range, shooting performance, image stabilization, battery life. It has a mid-level Electronic Viewfinder that can save your cookies in bright sunlight, and a very good wide viewing angle LCD for general shooting purposes.The notion of a bridge camera is broad and vague: it can mean just about whatever you want it to. It seeks to fill the gap between a shirt pocket point and shoot snapshot camera and a larger, heavier, more expensive DSLR system camera. At one time, the pocket camera was something like my old Canon Powershot A610, a 4X zoom 5 megapixel camera powered by four AA batteries, with a diminutive two inch articulated, low resolution LCD display and an inaccurate optical viewfinder. Back in its day, it was considered living large by many, including myself. The "5-megapixel CCD captures enough detail for photo-quality 13 x 17-inch prints" as was the ad-brag back then. In 2005, it carried a $299 retail price: a bargain at $100 less than the Canon A95 it replaced from a year prior, with its zoom increasing from 3-4x and its 2 inch LCD generous compared to the A95's 1.8 inch screen. While the A95 took 30-second video clips of 640 by 480 pixels in size and ten frames per second, the A610  grabs 640 by 480 at 30fps until you ran out of memory card or battery. The A610 was a bit over three quarters of a pound in operation.We've moved on from the dark ages of 2005, to the point where the old Canon A610 now isn't considered pocketable or to some folks, even usable. Shutter lag was .6 seconds or so, with shot to shot cycle time of about 1.1 seconds, with flash recycle time of about 5 seconds or so. This camera today looks like a crude, expensive contraption compared to the lighter and more pocketable long zoom cameras such as the Canon SX230 / SX260 / SX280 group, and the Panasonic ZS-15 / ZS-20.The basis for selecting the Lumix DMC-FZ60K is not to displace the comparatively inconspicuous pocketable travel zoom genre of camera, nor is it even to seek the best image quality regardless of price. The motivation here is an upcoming trip back to South Africa, and the desire to carry one affordable optical unit with good battery life replacing what I might otherwise carry: a Panasonic ZS-15, an LX7, and a dedicated video camera  with one unit of practical size, weight, and zoom.The approximately $290 street price 24x optical / 48x "Intelligent Zoom" FZ60K is very close in operation and envelope dimensions to the more celebrated Panasonic FZ200 (about $490 street). In fact, they both share the same owners manuals. The decision was made to go with the FZ60K on the basis of its lighter weight, smaller bulk, and smaller price than the FZ200, the Canon SX50, or the Sony HX200V. The Sony, as of this writing, is about $60 more, has a 30x zoom, but it was the Canon SX50 for about an extra $80 - $100 that offered the most appeal with its whopping 50x optical zoom capability. Actually, for some, the Canon may be the better choice. For me, it wasn't, despite the Canon's superior zoom range, RAW capability, and articulated screen. It was close, but the Canon lost out due to its approximately one third heavier weight, extra bulk, slightly slower lens, and weaker battery life (CIPA 310 shots). The primary stopper for me was the choppy 1080/24p video capability of the Canon compared to the 1080i60 capability of the FZ60. If HD video is of little interest to you, the Canon might well be your choice, at least until the FZ70 Panasonic LUMIX DMC-FZ70 16.1 MP Digital Camera with 60x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 3-Inch LCD (Black) becomes available: the apparent winner in zoom wars.There is a theory of image quality that holds that the higher pixel density, the less light each photosite can get, and overall image quality suffers. While the cleanest, sharpest pictures are certainly related to the largest sensor with the lowest pixel density along with the brightest lens, the reality is that there is a lot more to it than that. The FZ60 has a dinky 17.5 megapixels photo receptor 1/2.33 CMOS with an effective 16.1 MP ability, so you might think that spells doom for critical image quality. In this case, thankfully it is not so, and of note is that some makers such as Sony don't subscribe to this at all, for their HX200V sports an 18.2 MP sensor (18.9 MP photo-sites) on the same postage stamp sized 1/2.33 sensor . . . a whopping 20.4 MP on their forthcoming HX50 travel zoom. There is no doubt a limit to pixel density than can be effectively used, but it isn't an exact science nor readily apparent. High pixel cameras are apparently effective primarily for marketing, but as long as the images meet your personal standards of quality you do have more room to crop your photos after the fact, while still retaining enough image size to give you enough pixels per inch to do a 16 x 24 inch poster. Based on viewing distance, even a 5 MP image may net you 108 ppi, more than the 80 ppi often designated as needed.Panasonic has priced the FZ60 two hundred dollars less than their flagship FZ200 to make the FZ60 either the best on the market in the "price performance" ratio, or worthless depending on your needs and budget. If you need RAW, an articulated screen, a higher resolution electronic viewfinder, or are shooting regularly at full zoom under dim light . . . the FZ200 will empty another two hundred dollars from your wallet instantly, and you'll likely feel richer despite your thinner wallet. None of these are of great importance to me, for other cameras (LX-7) handily exceed the no flash, low light, low noise capabilities of any long-zoom bridge camera if that is requisite for the application. In the vast majority of outdoor still and video uses, you won't be able to tell the difference on any 8 x 10 framed print, much less a website image.The FZ60 24x zoom lens has a 35mm equivalent range of 25-600mm , starts out at an F2.8 aperture, slows to F4.1 at 300m, and finishes up at F5.6. It invariably lets a bit more light through than the 16x Panasonic ZS-15 (F3.3 - F5.9) and the 20x Panasonic ZS-20 (F3.3 - F6.4). Its battery life of 450 shots dwarfs the 260 shots of the ZS-15 and the 230 shots of the pocket long zoom Canon SX260 as well.It isn't all rosy with the FZ60, however. While Panasonic touts the 10 fps (frames per second) in 16.1-megapixel full resolution capability of this camera, it isn't happening. No way is anyone going to get ten frames per second at full resolution: two or three is it. It is one of the obvious problems when you start moving large files around; if you are hoping for machine gun 16.1 image burst shooting with this camera, you can forget it.What this camera offers, despite its $280 - $290 acquisition cost, over a shirt-pocket long zoom is an included external charger that saves you a few pesos against the slow, in-camera charging of several compacts, a color electronic viewfinder (202K), longer battery life, and manual focusing ability needed for cutting through brush, grass, and foliage. The flash unit is more powerful than many compacts; the 24x zoom is a fifty percent jump from the ZS-15 and similarly specified cameras. Some will find the larger size of the FZ60 far easier to hold steady than some of the flyweight pocket cameras, and it does retain the industry-leading Panasonic Intelligent Auto mode, generally peppy autofocus, start-up time, very good optical image stabilization, and brisk shooting performance. It adds eight new filter option special effects to the Lumix platform: the star effect and one point color are the most interesting.Although a bridge camera can just as well be called a compromise camera, at this price point ($283.52 delivered in my case) there isn't much to carp about, for its image quality is noticeably better than the competitively priced Nikon P510, Fuji HS30EXR, and the more expensive Sony HX200V. Although a jump in price, the Canon SX40 with its 50X lens is quite worthy of your consideration, especially if video frame rate at 1080p is not important to you, and you typically shoot with a tripod. You might call the FZ60 a stripper version of the FZ200, but the strip in price far exceeds overall camera performance in favor of the FZ60.For a camera bag that offers plenty of room for quick retrieval and replacement of the camera, I like the Case Logic DCB-305 "Camcorder Kit Bag."Case Logic DCB-305 Camcorder Kit Bag - Black Another bag that fits, but fits the FZ-60 quite snuggly is the Lowepro "Edit 100 Bag." If you want a bag that allows no movement at all, you'll want the Lowepro but I'm happier with the Case Logic overall. Rather than getting soaked for extra Chinese batteries with the official Panasonic logo, I picked up a pair of the "Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ47 DMC-FZ150 Digital Camera Battery - Premium DMW-BMB9 Battery" generic batteries, allegedly 1200mAh meaning higher capacity than OEM. They charge right up in the Panasonic charger and work beautifully in the FZ-60, with at least as good of operating life as the supplied battery.There are plenty of manual controls to satisfy most folks on the FZ-60. I shoot in 14M, 3:2 aspect ratio for the most part as it matches the three inch LCD's dimensions. In "IA" mode, indoors, low light, rarely would the camera shoot at more than ISO 400. Though the burst mode isn't much of a burst at all, the camera is speedy enough that you won't find yourself waiting between shots, the flash recycles quickly as well, and the video is just as bright as the stills with ambient lighting.I did do some side by side comparisons of the FZ60 against the Panasonic ZS-15 pocket zoom that uses the same sensor as the well-received FZ150 Panasonic 24x bridge model. A few things were easily discerned: the FZ60 LCD is far better, with essentially unlimited viewing angles, though both are 460K resolution. The FZ60, despite its sensor's higher pixel density, delivers sharper, clearer images. Where 16x images taken indoors across the room in dim lighting were shot at ISO 400 with both cameras, the aperture dimmed to F5.9 in the ZS-15 vs. F4.2 with the FZ-60.The FZ60, perhaps due to its carefully polished plastic body made by Old World Craftsmen is lighter than you might think in field use.Consider that a well-regarded DSLR lens alone, the Nikon AF Zoom-Nikkor 80-200mm, runs a thousand dollars or so, gets close to three pounds, yet cannot compete with the utility of the FZ60's 25-600mm zoom range.  The Intelligent Zoom feature, though not strictly as good as straight optical zoom, is a lot more than just a gimmick.I've uploaded a rabbit taken at 48 times zoom at sunset, handheld, just as it came out of the camera, along with a 48x goose and red-winged blackbird as well, all taken hand-held, as well as a macro image of a toad. Additionally, I've uploaded a few images taken during a recent safari to South Africa, that shows off this camera's field capabilities a bit.To sum up the FZ60, I'll call it "very good plus" in most every way. Very good plus images, very good plus video, very good plus shooting performance, very good plus LCD screen, very good plus battery life. It is fun to shoot with and is as close as you can get to an all-in-one outdoors still image and video acquisition system for $285 in a one pound package.Copyright 2013 by Randy Wakeman and randywakeman.com .

Reviews.Title: LOVE LOVE LOVE
Reviews.Author: Rachael
Reviews.Content: I am currently enrolled in a digital photography class and have fallen in love with this camera. Not only is it able to do all the manual functions I need but it also has great auto functions. I love this camera and have not had any problems with it and have owned in for more than a month now. Since buying it I have probably taken 3000-4000 pictures on it and they have turned out great! I highly recommend this for anyone who wants manual controls that easy to learn and use!

Reviews.Title: fz60
Reviews.Author: trigger
Reviews.Content: I am happy with the quality of still pics I get. I spend a lot of time in the backcountry photographing wildlife and I wanted another all purpose, lightweight camera. I would have given this camera a 5 star rating, however there is a lot of unwanted noise coming from the camera itself while shooting in video mode. I have not experienced this in previous Panasonic models or other brands like Kodak and Nikon. And trying to get help from Panasonic was futile. Still have no idea if I bought a lemon or if the problem is in all fz60 cameras. Good Luck!

Reviews.Title: I found my camera
Reviews.Author: A. Snyder
Reviews.Content: I have been talking pictures for 20 years. I have had point and shoot cameras for about the last 10 years. Recently my fuji 24x zoom camera broke for no reason after a little more than a year (of course!). Angry I went back to Nikkon and got a great deal on Nikon COOLPIX P510 16.1 MP CMOS Digital Camera with 42x Zoom. I really wanted to like that camera because I trusted the name and I wanted all that 42x zoom. It just lagged too much for me. I had to wait too long for the focus, the flash, and to take the next picture. What they don't tell you about long zoom lenses is that they require so much light at extended ranges, making anything past 15x inside useless. The killer for me was that its movie files are in Quicktime format (.mov) and I HATE dealing with crapple software. That prevented me from also trying Cannon's comprable point and shoot.And so I bought the Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ60K 16.1 MP Digital Camera with 24x Optical Zoom two weeks ago. Never tried a panasonic camera or knew they made cameras, but I had heard of Leica and was impressed that they made the lens. The camera was light weight, yet solid feeling in my hand. Everything is quicker, more responsive about this camera: The autofocus begins as soon as you touch the shutter button. No halfway to focus. When you take a picture, its ready to take the next one right away. The flash reloads fast. Although the zoom on this camera is not what others are, its usable magnification. I took a picture inside my house in my dark living room of something in my lit kitchen zoomed all the way and the picture was sharp, focused, and properly exposed. I can't back this up with technical specs, but it seems like this lens lets in more light then the other cameras.I have taken some MPEGs but haven't viewed them on anything bigger than the camera screen. I haven't tried the other modes, but there is lots to choose from. But I do know that this camera performs faster at taking pictures in auto mode than any other camera I have tried. There is a big race on between the camera companies to crank out the next camera with the longest zoom, even panasonic has a newer model (without the Leica lens) that has a longer zoom. There is a reason the zoom lenses on expensive SLRs are so wide, it is to allow for more light. There may be 50x or 42x zoom cameras out there, but you can only use all of that magnification if your shooting in bright sunny lighting.Try this camera. You won't send it back.

Reviews.Title: Lumix DMC- FZ60
Reviews.Author: J. M. Becker
Reviews.Content: After 3 weeks with this camera I can absolutely recommend it as probably the best all-around camera of this type.I was in search of a fast long zoom "bridge" camera after getting a Kodak Z990 8 months ago that took , what I thought at the time, was great pix. I researched and bought this Panasonic. I compared to all the other cameras in this genre that i could, including trying them at the stores. (this camera wasn't available locally so it was a case of hoping/researching) .After having the long zoom experience with the Kodak I wanted a long zoom but was dis-appointed with the Kodak's very erratic focusing, very slow performance when shooting and the occasional lock-up. All this was causing too many missed shots and increasing frustration !I just didn't want to have that be the "norm" for these "smaller sensor", long zoom type of camera.This camera restored my appreciation of this style camera!.The performance is great . The time to first shot, shudder lag/writing to memory is extremely quick and the auto focus is very quick and accurate. Out of 10 quick shots on different types of moving/not quite stationary  (eg. pets/kids) maybe 2 aren't perfect ! This was, like i said, very quick/ fast as possible between shots so that is great when trying to catch those elusive shots that you will usually only get 1 chance to capture.After experimenting with the auto settings and almost all the custom modes/settings I have found that the auto settings will deliver great pix as advertised but I prefer using the "P" mode, applying a +1 for sharpness and color, -1 for noise reduction and place an upper ISO limit of 400 to control noise and maintain a nice sharp picture. Even inside ( with flash at that max ISO ) these settings are good for my tastes.There are adjustments for just about everything and experimentation will reveal a setting that is perfect for your taste and then you can save that as a custom mode that you can recall at will !!The built in picture enhancements are fun and can also make some darker pix be enhanced and much improved.There is a "Hand-Held Night Shot" mode that is great for dark shots without the flash.I did not buy this for video recording but I did try it and the quality is as good as the reviews said! Will be handy if a situation comes up that I need video but I am caught with out the video camera.The battery is good for at least 350+ shots (depending on flash/zoom use) and charges quickly.The only slight limitations of this camera  (and all of this type ) are slightly slowed focusing in dark scenes and at extreme zooms (again, limitations of the sensors ) and this camera has some focusing options to help get the occasionally hard to focus subject focused properly!If you are looking for a camera with the zoom ability ( this camera, with the proper set-up, has  an enhanced, not digital, zoom of 48x with out visible image problems ) I recommend this camera, especially at the current, less than  $300.00 price.To get better pictures or performance you would have to make the jump to a full-fledged DSL camera/extra zoom lens combo that is at least 3x the price of this handy camera.

Reviews.Title: Longtime Panasonic FZ user
Reviews.Author: King Lerch
Reviews.Content: I love these Panasonic FZ style cameras. They have great zoom, great features, and are not too big/heavy. I have previously owned the FZ5 and FZ8. This FZ60 is a huge step above these. I took it on safari in South Africa and took 3200 pictures. I would point on the animal, hold the button, and let'r rip. I went the entire 8+ hour day of shooting without having to change the battery even once. Even took some videos that came out great.The best performance for this camera came when we saw lions amazingly far away. They looked like rocks from a distance of several hundred feet. But with the 24x, I was able to get fairly close fotos. Zooming in further, or copping if you will, let me see expressions on the tiny lion cub. At this level there are compression artifacts, but it is difficult to explain just how far away these images were. The FZ60 turned what would have been a "no picture possible" moment into some really decent fotos. The exposure was a little confusing for me, how the camera determined the proper exposure. It wasn't difficult with that thumb wheel to adjust the exposure, but when shooting an animal with trees around and sky behind, the exposure results varied greatly depending on where I ended up pointing. There are several exposure settings including bracketing, but I didn't try them all to find out which one was best.The Program AE mode worked the best for me. I did use the Shutter mode sometimes too, and it works great to tell you how much time you will need to keep the shutter open for a photograph in the darkness at your desired ISO setting. The Aperture mode is not as useful since you can't use the full aperture while zooming and changes in aperture at this level seem to do almost nothing. Maybe if I took more "non-zoomed" fotos this mode would make a difference. I tried Auto mode, which tries to determine the best setting for my scene, but generally the results were not as good as Program AE. I also love that you can turn down the flash intensity because the lowest flash setting is better in almost all circumstances than something brighter, which can kill so many indoor shots.For scene modes, I used the Panorama mode, but while a little interesting the definition was not great. The Sunset mode was very nice. I also tried the Handheld Night shot mode, which takes several photos and only keeps the one with the most clarity. I found this not to be *that* great, and preferred to take my own series of shots and choose the best one myself. There are 3 burst modes, 2FPS, 5FPS, and 10FPS, each with or without continual refocus on each shot. I used the 2FPS mode because although slower, the manual isn't clear that the other modes will sacrifice resolution for faster shots.The size and weight are great, even for hanging on a belt. I bought the Lowepro Edit 100 case after trying many that were too big or too small. This one worked perfectly for this camera. Generally, cases for this type of camera are difficult to find with a good fit. So while there are some imperfections in this camera, most of them are necessary due to the size and price. The FZ200 does a better job at a higher cost/size/weight. For my purposes, I love this FZ60 hybrid.

Reviews.Title: Great intermediate camera!
Reviews.Author: Sidra00
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because I'm really into amateur photography (I love taking photos of scenery while on vacation or just in the backyard, and of course, family and friends) but I'm not a photographer. I wasn't quite ready for a DSLR and that many settings and options, but I wanted more than a point-and-shoot. My previous camera was a high end, but basic point-and-shoot Panasonic and I always received compliments on how great my pictures turned out, and I loved the Leica lens all the different scene settings available, so I decided to go with another Panasonic. Not at all dissapointed! I have yet to really play around with it, but through the Holidays I used it for family and some outdoor pictures and it's great! The zoom is awesome, scene settings really help (there's even a setting for taking a photo through a glass window - awesome when I was trying to get shots of swans in the lake without going out in the snow at our cottage!) I can't wait to use it more!

Reviews.Title: I'm impressed!
Reviews.Author: gary h. webster
Reviews.Content: Ease of use is excellent, quite intuitive if you have any prior experience with digital camera menus.  It fits my hands very well and the size makes the camera very convenient to carry.  Optical quality is what one would expect from Leitz optics.  The automatic functions seem to work very well, but I've been a photographer for going on 50 years, so I have my own way of shooting and set the camera accordingly.  So far, the only thing I'd add is a variable output control for the flash.  The camera may have that function and I just haven't found it yet.  If anything changes, I'll let you know, but overall, I am more than pleased with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Winner
Reviews.Author: Mr. President
Reviews.Content: Just received the camera last week as an upgrade to my previous Panasonic FZ35 which i had for 3 years and loved. With that being said the FZ60 has evolved in some wondrous ways. In no particular order this is what I really like about it and some minor problems.Major Likes:- A little larger and heavier than the FZ35 which translates to a much better fit in the hand. Construction, fit and finish is very solid- 52mm lens diameter compared to 46MM for FZ35- Fantastic macro, with lens at max wide angle you can practically touch the subject- Photos seem sharper with much more detail and less noise- Movie button is in a better location- Better menus and easy to navigate- Fantastic creative filters including miniature effect all of which you can apply even after you've taken the shot- Very clear and sharp 3" lcd screen- Very quick start up!- Excellent movie quality- Great panorama featureMinor Dislikes:- On the FZ35 you could turn the camera on in playback mode (lens doesn't extend), with the FZ60 you have to turn camera on which extends the lens and then press playback- The rotary dial is a bit stiff and difficult to operate- I use this with Aperture 3.2.4, Mac OS 10.6. and it doesn't recognize the movies in the AVCHD format. It does fine with the MP4 format.- Viewfinder needs to be higher resolution. I love using a viewfinder and this is adequate but just barely.If you own a previous FZ model and are thinking about upgrading, you'll love this. If you're just looking for an excellent bridge camera below $300 this is the one.

Reviews.Title: Lumix DMC-FZ60K Review
Reviews.Author: B. Mac
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this camera to the person that is a step away from buying a SLR camera.  It has way more options that I will ever use, but is easy to operate while still allowing enough capability to fine tune settings.  We have had a number of point and shoot cameras and this one seems to blow away the others.

Reviews.Title: Good advanced point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I'm a sucker for cameras and own way too many. I love my DSLRs but sometimes I just don't want to worry about them so I wanted a point and shoot to carry around at times but it had to be something better than the traditional point and shoot. I think I found it with this camera. I love the longer zoom on it and the start up time is great. It has a nice set of filters and settings. I can also use it all day without the battery dying but it did require me charging it every night of our last vacation to Myrtle Beach. I think for our next trip to Disney I'm going to take an extra battery with me for the days I don't carry my DSLR since I tend to take a lot more pictures there.So, the most important thing is the picture quality. I have to say that it's pretty decent. It's not dslr quality but I never expected it would be. It is the closest to dslr quality that I've had with a point and shoot. I can get really nice color and sharpness even when using the fully automatic mode. When using the special setting such as panoramic the quality of picture is also nice and it's really simple to use. It's exactly what I want in a point and shoot and I feel the price was good for the camera I got.One last note, this camera is thicker that a traditional point and shoot. I knew that buying it buy apparently my husband didn't. It's not a large camera by any means but it isn't one that will fit in your pocket. For me it's a good compromise between a traditional P&S; and a DSLR. It will never replace my dslr but at least now I don't feel like I'm losing out on a decent picture if I don't take it with me.

Reviews.Title: Better image quality than FZ47
Reviews.Author: Detroit4ever
Reviews.Content: I had owned the Lumix FZ47 and it was a great camera.  Although, anything beyond ISO 400 showed a good deal of noise, which I probably par with a 1/2sensor.  The FZ60 uses a CMOS sensor compared to the CCD of the FZ47 and I feel this provides a better image!  The video on the FZ 60 is much better than the FZ47.  This is a very good camera and produces nice images.  Low Light situations are challenging, as to be expected.  I'm messing with the settings to combat the problem.  I think this camera does a good job across the board.  I wish that Panasonic would add a larger sensor to this line.  A larger sensor in this camera would make it a AWESOME.  I was surprised to see so little information on the web related to the FZ60, perhaps it there just wasn't enough to separate it from the FZ47.  This is a decent camera and I recommend it, especially if the price drops to below $299.99!!

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ60
Reviews.Author: Marshal Shlafer
Reviews.Content: I like it!  Bought this after checking out the Nikon P510 (and a newer comparable model) and the FZ200. Price was right. Have been using Nikon pro-level SLRs (film) and digital for as long as I can remember, wanted something smaller/lighter for those times when I don't want to lug around a larger body.The Lumix is great. Many features, accessing them using menu system quite intuitive, or at least easily accomplished with a quick check of the "advanced features" manual/file (downloaded as PDF). The Leica lens is quite sharp, reasonably fast. I don't have anything but favorable things to say re: lens sharpness, freedom from distortion, and so on. I suspect that although the lens is marked Leica, optically it's probably not on par with more advanced Leica lenses, and I doubt Leica would harm its reputation by putting out a bad lens with their brand name on it.One major limitation (at least for me): No RAW file output. Nonetheless, the hi-res JPEG images are great, so long as you don't keep editing and repeatedly saving the edited files. (Edit copies of the JPEGs, not the originals.)Low light focusing a bit slow, but nothing insurmountable, although none of the 100+ photos I took the first weekend the camera was in my possession were of fast action. Zooming in or out seems sort of tentative: zoom goes slowly at first, then suddenly (it seems) continues to zoom in or out as operator desired.  The lens might actually benefit from slower but less tentative or jerky changes of focal lenght.Viewfinder (as opposed to LCD, to which one can easily switch) takes a bit of getting used to, as once a photo is taken the stilled image of the photo remains in the viewfinder for several moments before returning to a live view. The nature of the beast, I guess. On the other hand, there seemed to be exceedingly little shutter lag.One reason why I opted for this as opposed to, say, the Nikon Coolpix P510, is that the front of the lens is threaded for various photo filters, the most important of which to me is a polarizer. Sadly, and it was a deal-braker for me re: the Nikon, the Coolpix lacked filter threads on the front of the lens. And, unfortunately (and in contrast with the FZ60's more expensive sibling, the 200), no lens shade was provided. However, appropriately sized snap on hoods are readily available and for not much money.While I said I was pleased that the Leica lens has front threads for filters (whereas the Nikon does not), I should mention that I think the threads on the FZ-60 weren't deep enough. A polarizing filter indeed screws on, but if rotating it counterclockwise the shallow threads make it easy for the filter to unscrew completely and fall if not being held securely..The Lumix IS light, and although I have somewhat large hands, it poses no problems with grip or manipulating the controls.In short, I'm highly pleased with this little Lumix, especially considering its feature set and the price. I can't think of (nor have found) any issues with this camera that would lead me to give it a poorer recommendation. Indeed, I probably short-changed the camera with a 4 star rating. No regrets whatsoever about the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Personal opinion about the camera LUMIX FZ60
Reviews.Author: Norman Salazar
Reviews.Content: Firstly, I recommend the camera LUMIX FZ60 because it has almost all the functions and tools of a professional camera. For beginners it is easy to use. Also, it has a powerful zoom (24x) that takes clear photos and creative effects.

Reviews.Title: Excellent for beginners to intermediate users
Reviews.Author: LaughingLion "I am Lion, read me review!"
Reviews.Content: Before this camera I'd never owned anything but a simple point and click. I'd gotten so ok pictures with those and occasionally the rare great one.This one here has lots, and lots, and lots of ways to get lost. But takes very good pictures even on automatic.If you pick up a book that explains what things do what or better still take a class in photography, you'll end up taking pictures every bit as good as some cameras that cost two to four times as much.The zoom is great, the battery life is great, you can adjust fstop, shutter speed, ISO, focus, and all sorts of other things that will be meaningless to beginners until they've used it and read up on the art of photography. If I were going to make a complaint I'd like a few more of the toys the $800+ range cameras have, but for under $300 that would be utterly silly.This is the book I'm using to learn more about photography:Digital Photography: A Basic ManualBut half the fun of learning is getting a big memory card and going out and fiddling with the settings as you take multiple shots of people, places and things and then looking at what settings (in the properties of the pic) produced the best pictures.

Reviews.Title: Well done Panasonic!!
Reviews.Author: Gene E. Heller "slickshot"
Reviews.Content: Consumer report said this camera and an Olympis were the better of this style units--we have had very good success with other Panasonic items, plus I thought the envelope word serve better with my larger hands, The unit performs very well for the type of use we expected, that of high school sports, indoor and outdoor swimming--shutter speed very good and photo clarity excellent. Battery will last for about 450 photos with little flash use. We always buy extra batteries for any of our items. Zoom feature is unbelievable, it will bring objects from very far away to filling the view screen. It also has the a view finder that can be turned on for detailed long shots!Great camera

Reviews.Title: Canon? I don't need no stinkin' Canon!
Reviews.Author: Melissa Mermaid
Reviews.Content: I just don't understand why Canon DSLRs get the "focus" they do. For the most part, I am enthralled with the Panasonic Lumix line. I have several of them in addition to my new FZ60 (e.g., ZS19, ZS9, FZ 28, FZ40, etc) and am enthusiastic about the soon-to-be-released FZ70. Additionally, I own a Canon SX40, a Sony HX20V, and a Nikon P510. I love photography and a photo that emulates an SLR as much as possible--without the time, energy & finances they demand.I am pretty much the go-to person for recording all kinds of events from bees buzzing around my hydrangeas to parties to karaoke night and live music events at my local pub, so I need a camera that is up to the task even when "setting up a shot" is not possible. The FZ60 is a high quality point and shoot with lots of tasty features that will occupy any photo hobbyist. It takes amazing portraits and macros with little effort and the response time is exceptional. It shoots almost as swiftly as if I'm using the burst feature and even when using flash, is surprisingly speedy (definitely not so with the SX40, with which the word "Busy" appears much too frequently for my tastes).The FZ60 also has in-camera creative options (having the most fun especially with the 1-color feature).  I'm surprised that some people say there is noise on the zoom when shooting video because I haven't really noticed it and I've shot video in a variety of circumstances ranging from silent to loud.  But I can without reservation tell you that the quality of the video is outstanding.All around, the FZ60 is a big win for me! As was the vendor and well, with Amazon… I NEVER lose!

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ60K Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Ed
Reviews.Content: I bought the Panasonic FZ-40 about 2yrs. ago and was very happy with it, but I wanted something with more zoom and the price was right so I purchased the Panasonic FZ-60. The two cameras are very much alike except for the following advantages the FZ-60 has. Panoramic photos, better low light shots, and you can take a number of pictures just by holding the shutter button down and when your done shooting just delete the shots you don't like. For example if someone blinks at the time you click the shutter button. The zoom is better but if you zoom in too much the pictures show some noise or graininess. I love the camera and am very happy I purchased it. At the time I bought the Panasonic FZ-40 back in April 2011 I paid $317.00 for it through the Amazon Warehouse with a like new description which was right on the money. I bought the Panasonic FZ-60 in April 2013 when Amazon's price was $289.09. Before I bought it I checked the internet for the lowest price, which I found to be $239.00 at another website. I then phoned Amazon and told them what I did and gave them the website so they could verify my story. The man told me because the $239.00 price I found was more then a $20.00 difference Amazon would match the $239.00 price, which they did. I have bought thousands of dollars of merchandise from Amazon and have yet to be disappointed. I have never had a problem, buying or returning from Amazon. I wish all business's would be so nice to their customers.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Lisa Jenkins
Reviews.Content: Takes great pictures and hardly ever a blurry one.  Settings are easy to understand and to change.  Battery lasts forever!

Reviews.Title: Best Lumix I've owned.
Reviews.Author: Alaska Pundit "rwp"
Reviews.Content: I own two earlier models of the Lumix.  Both are point and shoot, but my wife and kids now use them.  I upgraded to this Lumix model, and I am extremely pleased.  Great starter camera for an amatuer/novice photographer who wants to start taking more technical photos.

Reviews.Title: I Like it
Reviews.Author: ana loyo
Reviews.Content: Is , Easy, practical, have many utils options and picture have a high quality.Excelent sound. Recommended camera panasonic lumix.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use
Reviews.Author: R.Lotus Russell
Reviews.Content: I have an older Kodak Easy Share 10x zoom camera.  This one was very similar-just faster, lighter and with a stabilizer control.  The pictures are crystal clear and so far it hasn't taken a bad picture.  I have only used it on the automatic setting, but plan to learn how to use the manual settings experimentally for photos.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Camera
Reviews.Author: ReaderLisa
Reviews.Content: This camera is terrific.  I bought it for a trip to Yellowstone where I knew is would need both high zoom for animals and wide angles for scenery.  It performed well beyond my expectations.  It was light enough to take on hikes, much better than my DSLR.  It was awesome to not have to change lenses.  It was fast enough that I never missed a shot I wanted.  I got amazing shots of wolf cubs who were more than 1/4 mile away.  Best of all, the camera compensates for my uncontrollable hand shake.  None of my shots were out of focus - this is the first camera I can say that with.I am a hobby photographer only.  Many of the camera's features are wasted on me because I rely on AF.  However, the camera is smart enough to make up for my inexperience.  It worked as well in low light at my kids' school play.There are some things,I'd like to see enhanced.  The LCD doesn't work well in bright light, so I relied heavily on the viewfinder for composition.  However, the AF doesn't focus in the viewfinder, so I learned to trust the light and sound that indicate focus.  I probably wound up taking more shots than I would have otherwise because I couldn't really tell whether the shots were good until I reviewed them later.  But in this time of 20gb flash cards, there's no real cost associated with that.I think this is the last camera I will need for a long time,

Reviews.Title: Just what I needed
Reviews.Author: briegull "briegull"
Reviews.Content: It is going to be a great travel camera.  This is not the latest model so it doesn't have wifi which is a slight disadvantage, but it takes so much better pictures than a point and shoot, with so much less effort and weight than an SLR, that I'm quite happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for what I wanted it for.....
Reviews.Author: Jerry
Reviews.Content: Planning to take a vacation in Alaska this summer and wanted a camera I felt could do the job, for not big bucks. Found this camera and after reading all the great reviews got one. Have been please so far and plan to enjoy.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I have owned earlier Lumix models. This is the easily the best.The new panorama feature is very cool.. it does it all...you just pan across scene.The zoom is clear, even past 24 optical...to what, 50?Sharpest pix i have ever taken.  Even at {option 1} on the Mac one can see good definition.Color is as true as I can compare with the real thing.  Everything: intensity, tint, whatever, is spot on.Just a sweet camera.Software is logical and easy to navi.  More options than I need.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DCM-FZ60K
Reviews.Author: richard harmon
Reviews.Content: Great camera well worth the money. Takes beautiful pictures and is easy the use. This camera has all the bells and whistles that a person would want on a camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: M. Blair
Reviews.Content: Great camera and very good value -- super pictures and very easy to use -- will use it often for all my photos

Reviews.Title: I love this Camera
Reviews.Author: Andres Leonardo
Reviews.Content: Is my first Brigde camera!, and this is amazing, the zoom, the functionalities every is perfect, the size is excellent and the battery

Reviews.Title: best camaera
Reviews.Author: Sharon LeVan
Reviews.Content: i have had many different comeras over the years.  the last two have been Lumix.  it is easy to use.  autofocus works at all zoom levels with absolutely beautiful pictures.  i love it

Reviews.Title: Good Camera Overall
Reviews.Author: EB
Reviews.Content: I've been quite pleased with Panasonic cameras. It's not as easy to use as my Lumix ZS6, but the photos are turning out just as nice. Of course, the zoom is awesome. The icons and buttons take some getting used to, and it's a little too easy to press the burst or video button instead of the snapshot button. I wish it came with a lens hood to cut down on sunlight glare.  Plenty of features to explore and learn with. Overall, a good purchase and recommended.

Reviews.Title: This is our second one!
Reviews.Author: Elisa
Reviews.Content: We LOVE this camera. The value, features and functionality of the camera is so worth the amazing price, compared to others. My husband has been a photographers for over 20 years, and have all the high end 4-digit cost camera bodies and lenses and he even likes this one for a small compact on-the-go camera.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE IT!!
Reviews.Author: Katie
Reviews.Content: the best camera that I've had since my 2003 fuji!!simple, yet outstanding options AND easy to use..  the best !I cannot say enough good things about this camera !I recommend this to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix
Reviews.Author: Dennis W. Dennington "DWD"
Reviews.Content: Great camera!!! Exceeded my expectation with great color shots. Zoom reaches out to whatever I can see and brings it back. Easy to use. Great value.

Reviews.Title: no brainer point and shoot with a big zoom lens
Reviews.Author: Mike Lyons
Reviews.Content: I wanted a no brainer point and shoot camera with a big zoom lens for taking pictures of the kids from a distance (soccer games, concerts, etc).  That's exactly what this is.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: Marsha Shaw
Reviews.Content: EAsy to operate.  Able to take bursts of shots.  Auto focus limits blurred pics to minimum.  No need for flash inside during the day making color very natural. Don't need to reset date every time battery is loaded.  We got wonderful pictures of our 6 month old granddaughter!

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: RodC
Reviews.Content: Aftrer a lot of reserach I foun this camera and it is the best price/quality ratio that I foun, I am completely pleased with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Good gift
Reviews.Author: Linda K Hoffmann
Reviews.Content: This was a gift for my daughter. She loves it. It takes fantastic pictures. Reasonable price for what you get.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for me
Reviews.Author: Gordon K. Rogers "gordon"
Reviews.Content: Have 3 Panasonic Cameras, all great.The FZ60 is perfect for me the 24 times zoom is great.Have not used a tripod, does not seem to need it, take long zoom pictures while walking.Keep in mind if you use the 48 times zoom the mega pixel is reduced and does not work on automatic setting.A little tricky to set shutter speeds in manual, have to get to teach myself how to do it quick.Pictures are sharp and clear.If you take a back lighted shot on auto outdoors it takes more frames by it self and comes up with a great picture, it notifies you on screen when this happens.I Have had it only a short time and have not tried out all the scene modes.I usually use Happy mode, more vivid colors, do this on all three cameras.I would say a great bridge camera towards using a SLR.This is the only Lumix that I have with a view finder, having a view finder made up my mind which on to purchase.So far so good, lot of camera for the money, takes pictures just as well as others the cost 5 times as much and you do not have to lug other lenses around.The flash is very strong does a good job even when using a moderate zoom. With my other cameras I tend to use a slave strobe to get good carry.Have not tried the movies feature yet.The screen and viewfinder image is not a true image as far a color, but when downloaded images are great.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE MY Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ60K 16.1 MP Digital Camera with 24x Optical Zoom
Reviews.Author: Wayne Yhost
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ60K 16.1 MP Digital Camera with 24x Optical Zoom for the Holidays and I love it . The 3" viewing screen is just what I needed to be able to see and focus easily. The timer and multiple shot feature helped me to take large family photos with ease. Taking short movies of the grandchildren was an added bonus.

Reviews.Title: Awesome picture quality
Reviews.Author: Peter A. Yacukowicz
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is incredible.  The camera is a little more bulky than the Nikon 1 or others, but still fits comfortably in one hand

Reviews.Title: Beware - all current sellers appear to be selling gray market cameras (which invalidates your warranty)
Reviews.Author: Shelley Cerata
Reviews.Content: Edited 8/19/13: Please see David Marks' review as well as mine and read the comments on both our reviews, as several other reviewers have commented there that they also got gray market cameras.  At the very least, Amazon Warehouse Deals and Photo Savings are selling gray market, unrepairable-by-Panasonic cameras. Their warranties are invalid and you can't even pay Panasonic to fix the camera if it breaks. I contacted several of the other 3d Party sellers asking them to confirm they were selling legal, US-warrantied cameras and none of them would. Please be sure you know what you are buying. A lot of the great reviews for the camera seem to be completely unaware of the issue, and if this camera breaks you may be pretty much stuck with it. It would make for an expensive paperweight, folks.xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxOriginal review:I hate it when people leave reviews that aren't really reviews per se, but are more about a problem with the individual item purchased. However, this is so egregious I don't see how I can do anything but give a 1 star rating.When I received the camera the default language was in Spanish. Sure enough, I looked at the warranty and it was for Latin America. I called Panasonic and they confirmed that this camera's warranty wouldn't be supported. When I spoke to Amazon, they informed me that Amazon Warehouse Deals is considered a third party seller and that my only option was to return the camera. For the record, I only ordered a used / warehouse deals camera because I thought it was considered part of Amazon and therefore I would be guaranteed to receive a US market, non-gray market item.As of right now, you cannot purchase this camera directly from Amazon at all. I actually quite liked the camera, but will not buy electronics with an invalid warranty. It appears that the third party sellers are allowed to sell gray market items, but Amazon should really be forcing them (and Warehouse Deals) to make it clear that the manufacturers will NOT honor a warranty for these gray market cameras. Really disappointed by all this.

Reviews.Title: I swear my old FZ28 took crisper pictures
Reviews.Author: Aaron Neuman
Reviews.Content: OK, great features here, long lens, HD movies, high MP, decent aperture, just not great pictures.  The red eye flash delay is horrible for children.  It pre-flashes to reduce the possibility of red eye and then flashes when it takes the picture.  By then everyone has looked away...  It wasn't for us.

Reviews.Title: Love it!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Spunk "DaveN"
Reviews.Content: Love it! My pictures have been amazing since the first one I took. It has a ton of features that have been fun experimenting with. It is a nice step up from your typical point and shoot. This is my third Panasonic and all I can say is I will never buy another brand.

Reviews.Title: This is a great camera
Reviews.Author: hardworking golfer
Reviews.Content: I just bought the DMC-FZ60 to replace my old FZ35 that I've owned for some years. The DMC-FZ60 is a great camera. Panasonic has made great improvements on the camera. It's now easier to use the video function and the grip handle has been redesigned and feels perfect. At the same time Panasonic has kept the weight down which is important for me.My old FZ35 had great Leica lens with 18X zoom. The FZ60 added more zoom which is great. Shooting picture with zoom is great and stability is good at max range.This is great improvement without the extra cost and a perfect hybrid camera for people that like to take good pictures/video and use it while doing hiking or other outdoor sports. The only drawback is lack of flash shoe for indoor picture in low light.

Reviews.Title: Best balance out there!
Reviews.Author: Ben
Reviews.Content: If you are fun of photography but don't want to invest in an SLR camera, this is the best option I would recommend.I was delighted to discover that this version is made in Japan, NOT in China.No need to be a professional to be able to shoot some great pics with it. The zoom is awesome and do not require much of stability, so no need for a tripod.I just love this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Images and a Big Bang for the Buck!
Reviews.Author: Jerry
Reviews.Content: We have been loyal Panasonic Lumix fans for years since our Sony and Canon digital cameras suddenly stopped working during our travels abroad where heat and humidity are challenges to electronics. This is the second Panasonic Lumix camera that we own. It's images are sharp and the colors are accurate and vivid. The feature we like most is the extreme zoom capabilities not found in many cameras of this price range. This camera gives us the same joy experienced when using our Nikon 35mm SLR's, but with the enhanced benefits of a digital camera.

Reviews.Title: What a great camera!
Reviews.Author: frances
Reviews.Content: Has abit of a learning curve, yet having this for only 2 days, does not seem too difficult.  Love the size and telephoto capabilities.  There is a "Pet" mode which allowed me to really get details of my almost all black cat for the first time.. Got a really nice price for this Lumix from Amazon.  Has almost all the features of the higher model, the FZ200, just cannot capture RAW, only JPEG.  Think I will love this camera the more I use it, so far it is very impressive. The artistic edits are cool too. Takes extremely crisp shots and seems to focus fast.  Would highly recommend this as a great camera in between my DSLR and Point and shoot.  Battery charges fast, seems to last, took 387 photos , no low battery signal.  Outer build quality exemplary, feels comfortable in hand, also has a superb eye piece viewfinder.  Really like this camera!!  Very smooth operation.  A good choice with alot of new and interesting features.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Lorraine Sease
Reviews.Content: Just bought my second one of these in four months after crushing my first.  I still don't use half the features but fabulous pics. A rare view finder. Great zoom.  Considered spending about 3times as much but so glad I didn't.  Unles you really want to take professional pics no need to spend more than this.  I bought this one after reading consumer reports. This Was the  top rated in its class.

Reviews.Title: Love, Love, LOVE This Camera!!!
Reviews.Author: Lisa
Reviews.Content: I began looking for a camera before going on a family trip.  Over the last couple of years, I have just used my phone (which has a pretty nice camera built in) but remembering to use it as a camera has always been a struggle for me so I have missed many photo opportunities because I forgot to use the one on my phone.  I spent several hours researching the kind of camera I needed and once I locked that down spent several more hours finding the best value for the best price that fit my needs.  I am not a photographer by any stretch of the imagination (and I might be a little flakey and lazy) so I really needed a camera that 'did the work for me' but I also wanted one that would allow me to be in control if I found the inclination.  This camera seemed fit the bill perfectly - And it certainly has!Some of the things I loved (I don't think there is a way that this list can be all inclusive) -- Perfect size.  When I'm holding this camera, it feels like a camera and all of the buttons are easily accessible while secure in my grip.- The battery life seems to be amazing.  I shot 400 pictures with some video footage as well and still did not even come close to running out of battery.- The picture quality is superb.  When I was in automatic mode, all of my pictures came out crisp and clear.  They were beautiful on my computer and beautiful when printed.  I did some editing on some with an online software and they didn't have much work to do when it came to 'auto adjusting' the pictures.- The zoom is awesome. We went to a baseball game at Target Stadium and sat in the 306 section (look it up, it's WAY up there) and I was able to take pictures of the players that made it look like I was right on the field.  I was able to zoom in close enough to capture the players names and numbers on their shirts very clearly and the quality of the picture did not seem to be affected.  Don't get me wrong, I haven't tried to blow any of these up bigger than 4x6 but they look amazing on the computer and in the 4x6 printed size.  I read a few reviews where there were complaints about the length of time it took the camera to refocus when zooming in to this degree... Did it take some time? Yes.  Was it worth it the wait?  Yes.  Are you going to be able to turn this camera on, whip it up, zoom it in and take a picture of something that is fast moving? Probably not, but if you're already zoomed to the distance you want, it only takes a second to refocus.  In my opinion, the quality of the zoom outweighed the time it took to focus.- Starting to record a video is a simple on step process.  One button, push and your recording.  If you are zoomed in, it records from the zoom position you are in.  Oh, and you can still snap pictures while the video is recording.A couple of things I didn't love (this list IS all inclusive at this time) -- I can't tell what is video when I'm reviewing the pictures on the camera.  I enlisted the help of a friend who has more camera knowledge than I and she finally found it.  The only difference seems to be that the picture (1st frame of the video) is a little different shape than the pictures... Keep in mind that this doesn't mean that this is the only way to make the determination, but it's the only way I have found so far.- The video files are in some cryptic file that my computer doesn't really know how to handle.  That being said, I have not downloaded my pictures to the computer that I have the software on.  I have another laptop that reads SD cards and have just inserted the card and moved the pictures that way.  I'm guessing that the software has something to convert these files, but I rarely use that computer (and can't put the software on the computer I do use) so it has been inconvenient for now.  I really don't know if this would affect someone who uploaded the pictures using the included software.One last note about the camera - I showed some of my pictures to a friend who is a photographer for a small town paper and other assorted media affairs and she was quite impressed with the quality.All the other bells, whistles and manual modes?  I've tried some of them but can't really speak to them because I have no idea what I was really doing, but I can say that they all seemed to work :)

Reviews.Title: Amazing quality. OK indoor photos.
Reviews.Author: Jared
Reviews.Content: Wonderful camera for outdoor use. Very crisp photos. Even when enlarged, the picture maintains the quality with very little distortion in the photos. It can take amazing macro shots if you use it right. Indoor photos are alright, not the best though. You need the right lighting for the picture to turn out well. Flash is decent, but is rather short. All in all, the outdoor photos are amazing, the in camera editing is very useful and doesn't detract the quality of the original photo. It has a wide range of things for editing.

Reviews.Title: Camera Review
Reviews.Author: ROX THE HOUSE "ROX THE HOUSE"
Reviews.Content: I am totally pleased with this great camera! I read all reviews until I committed to this purchase . It takes excellent photos and movies and is relatively easy to learnIt doesn't have a touch screen but I don't care due to so many options which I think are easier to use than some touch screen!  Super zoom! That is what I was looking for too and a great lens too!It was delivered quickly and I bought the kit with charger and extra battery !So far I would buy another , highly recommend it for the zoom too!

Reviews.Title: amazing camera
Reviews.Author: Amber B.
Reviews.Content: I had the old one that came out in 2005. It only had 6mp. This one has 16.1 and is an amazing improvement. I am in love with this camera. It takes wonderful pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Charles Allen
Reviews.Content: This camera takes the best pics I have ever seen from a person like me behind the view finder... Also, dont let the salesmen fool you, megapixels do make a difference. They may not be the only factor in picture quality, but they are a Big part of it. Either way, this camera rocks.

Reviews.Title: I have no complaints whatsoever with my nerw camera......Love it!
Reviews.Author: Vicki Combs
Reviews.Content: Thias camera does everything I could ask for in a camera and more! Nice clear pictures even from a long distance! Love it!

Reviews.Title: Sonenjoys
Reviews.Author: Lynne W. Kada
Reviews.Content: My son really likes this camera, it takes great photos, movie clips with a fast refresh rate for sports photos

Reviews.Title: good camera
Reviews.Author: matthew d mooney
Reviews.Content: I'm just a casual photographer.  But this camera does everything I could ask of it and more.  I love the extra features that you get when you move above a point and shoot

Reviews.Title: Everything You Could Ask For
Reviews.Author: Terry Kennedy
Reviews.Content: I am well satisfied with this camera. It has plenty of advanced features but the nice thing about it is you can set it on automatic and it does all the thinking for you.. It takes beautiful pictures too.

Reviews.Title: Wow!
Reviews.Author: D. Weisner "kayaker"
Reviews.Content: I went from a DMC-FZ4 to this, WOW! Great camera! Keep up the good work Panasonic! Very easy to use, great pictures!

Reviews.Title: After shaky start. It's a Great Camera
Reviews.Author: sub tropical
Reviews.Content: This camera has not been with us 24 hours.  Our hope is that in thenext week we will locate some instructions online.Follow-up a week later: After giving up on finding a "Quick Start" or a simple how to instruction, a complete user manual was located on the web. I just put the camera on "auto" and the  photos come out great.

Reviews.Title: Better than I expected!
Reviews.Author: Michael Mastin DBA
Reviews.Content: So far I am very happy with the photo quality and operation of this camera.  The capabilities are very nice IMO.

Reviews.Title: Real nice camera for the price
Reviews.Author: AmerRev
Reviews.Content: I haven't got to use this a whole lot yet.  I was fortunate to buy when Amazon had this on sale for $229.00.  I feel that is an excellent price for all the features this camera has.  I compared to the Canon SX50 and Nilkon P500 and for the price this seemed to be the best way to go.  I was currently using a 6MP older lumix so this FZ60 is quite a bit nicer.

Reviews.Title: Fantasctic Camera
Reviews.Author: Samuel
Reviews.Content: It is a fantastic camera, since I started using the photos I got were very clear and without tripod, heartily recommend this camera, excellent value for money

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Video, nice Photos
Reviews.Author: Zoom
Reviews.Content: Recieved my new FZ60 camera from Amazon and tested both video and long zoom features. I am very pleased with the quality and great video (clear and crisp). my previous camera (SX40)was poor in video but photos were OK, like my FZ60. I am very pleased with the Panasonic. My wife loves Her FZ47, but now she plans to upgrade to the same FZ60 camera that I have.

Reviews.Title: What? No lens hood?
Reviews.Author: Vicki
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. Takes great photos! The manual is one that covers the FZ100 as well, making life a little annoying. But the big surprise is that no lens hood is included. Not only is there no lens hood, but they don't even make one for this model! Don't order one from DeBroth on Amazon. It has an adapter that is so long it looks like you're taking pictures through a toilet paper roll. It cuts off the view of the corners of your shot when using the viewfinder. I hate using the screen to compose and shoot pictures.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera with a viewfinder
Reviews.Author: Richard
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a camera with a view finder that was easy to use.  Ratings and reviews were good.  So far I like the camera especially the view find feature.  Still learning how to use the camera.  More later.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, wish the 10fps wasn't just hype.
Reviews.Author: Chadwick A. Gipson
Reviews.Content: First, let me say I really like this camera. I have a FZ28 and bought this as an upgrade. I like the higher resolution, the faster autofocus, and the low light handling. However, the loss of the longer than 4 second exposures and the lack of a true high frame rate sequential shot is disappointing. The 10fps is good, but only for three shots. Even the 5fps rate can't be sustained for more than a second! Had I know that I might not have purchased. I don't know why the high-speed data transfer evidently available for higher end cameras like the Nikon 7D can't be ported to this camera, but if it could it make this camera amazing!

Reviews.Title: Very Fine Camera
Reviews.Author: Paul D. Donnelly
Reviews.Content: It arrived on time and in perfect condition with all accessories.  After reading the quick start instructions I used it right away with excellent results,  I've been taking pictures, mostly family and vacation (a lot of photos) for about 45 years and this camera is perfect.  I didn't want an SLR because I didn't want to carry and change lenses.  Other reviewers have issues, but having used Nikon, Pentax and Connon over the years I find the performance and build quality perfectly equal to similar models from those brands.  The zoom is great, and I have had no problem shooting indoors and out.  It has a myriad of features and shooting settings that seem pretty intuitive and it recovers quickly enough to suit my needs.  I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: J. Li
Reviews.Content: The only cameras I ever bought before were the pocket point-and-shoot kind.  This camera is leaps and bounds ahead of the best pocket camera.  It takes sharp pictures even with the zoom fully extended.  Night shots are also quite clear.  I am having a lot of fun with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Good solid purchase
Reviews.Author: Sandi Ryan
Reviews.Content: Only complaint is the cost of the memory card---woozers! Make sure you look (and buy) at the same time, or you will discover, like I that they are not that easy to find locally.

Reviews.Title: It's what I expected
Reviews.Author: RDD
Reviews.Content: Easy to use just point and shoot. Also a lot of functions for advanced users. With optical 24X nothing it’s far. Just great!

Reviews.Title: Incredible images
Reviews.Author: SigmaSpace "SigmaSpace"
Reviews.Content: I have three Nikon DSLRs. Bought an FZ60 for my wife. Comparing images of my Nikon AF-S 70-300mm ED lens to the FZ60's from extremely distant objects to closer ones, after cropping and/or as taken, I dare say 80-90% of the time the FZ60 wins hands down. Price-wise I believe this is a great value. So I bought one for myself as well to have on trips, carrying only a polarizing and a UV filter. I have uploaded a few snapshots with the FZ60 to show zoom-in details.As I am writing this, Panasonic is discontinuing the FZ60 and are coming out with a 60X Zoom FZ70 in a few weeks. The new FZ70 Optical Zoom Panasonic lens might turn out to be another success, however this 24X Leica lens ( 600mm equivalent?) is terrific.  I believe this is a great Leica lens and at $269.95 is a great buy. Prices have gone up lately for the few remaining FZ60's for obvious reasons.I would urge purchasing from a reputable authorized Panasonic dealer as I read alarming reviews about unauthorized dealers peddling grey-market cameras with missing package contents, foreign language settings, and unenforceable warranties.

Reviews.Title: Great photos and fast shooting too!
Reviews.Author: machinehead "Feed them to the Lions"
Reviews.Content: Grab shots never been easier for this photographer. Point and fire! No problem. I have been using this more than my Panasonic G1 and G2 with many lenses. The G makes better pictures, but the convience of the long zoom trumps my lens collection for most shooting. Of course my 20mm f1.7 gets used a lot especially around ChristmasTime!Get this instead of the FZ150 or FZ200

Reviews.Title: Auto mode is exceptional
Reviews.Author: Prisoner of Appalachia
Reviews.Content: took it to greenland and left it on auto mode the whole time.  My Pictures are awesome!  The video is awesome also.

Reviews.Title: Overall excellent camera
Reviews.Author: DesertShopper
Reviews.Content: I'm new to this camera Nd dont fully know how to best utilize all features. So far the images have been sharp, in focus, and it's reasonably easy to use.The only feature that I'm not impressed with is under "creative control." The One Color select is rather broad, or not too accurate, so if youre taking an image with multiple colors present, you don't get distinct one color with the rest black and white. I tried this feature on other cameras and it worked much better on the Nikon.Other than that one thing, the images are great, the video sound is clear and crisp, it has a nice shape so you can get a good grip on it. Yes, for the price and features its a super camera. Again, comparing price points, what you get for your money, Lumix is excellent.

Reviews.Title: Lumix DMC-FZ60K
Reviews.Author: brian1209
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as an upgrade to my pocket point and shoot camera. The FZ60 works great!I use the automatic settings because I lack the experience to properly use the manual settings. Anyway, the automatic settings are doing everything I could ask of it. Within a couple of weeks of getting this camera I was on a vacation trip. Outdoor settings, indoor settings, landscapes, people, moving vehicles, still shots, movies etc. all of these and 95% of the shots are really good, if not great (at least compared to my past efforts).As compared to a pocket point and shoot, one has to be more careful handling the FZ60 because of the lens and the FZ60 is heavier and more bulky. But I feel that is a good trade-off for the picture capabilities and picture quality.I would recommend this camera to a friend.

Reviews.Title: Fabulous camera
Reviews.Author: oldbackpack
Reviews.Content: I'm a panasonic fan I have previously owned the FZ20 and find this camera superior in every respect. Takes fabulous pictures. I like the way it goes into automatic macro if you are shooting close-ups of flowers etc. Have done a few portraits with it and people are really impressed. I also have a TZ5 which is a handy travel camera, but the FZ60 is light enough that it's going on all my trips.I also bought the Hoya 52mm super Pro 1 UV filter to protect the lens, and a flex armor camera sleeve to protect it in my backpack.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: Richard J Collins
Reviews.Content: I got this to replace a Nikon P80, which was a nice camera for it's time. I'd have bought the fz200, but it's a little steep for my pocketbook.I don't think you can beat the fz60 on price/performance (I see the price is down from what I paid). I use it a lot for nature shots, birds, squirrels and anything else that wanders into our yard. I'm very pleased with the results. I'm a photoshop addict, so it's nice to have all those pixels to play with.I also own a Lumix lx7 that I like for snapshots of family gatherings, etc.

Reviews.Title: A Terrific Upgrade
Reviews.Author: Canongate
Reviews.Content: I do love this camera. It is small enough to comfortably carry around and does a great job. The increase in battery power from the DMC-FZ18 makes operation of the zoom and shutter seem awesome. The manual was in Spanish and camera menu was set up in Spanish when it arrived. The English version of the manual on the CD is user "un-friendly" but that is par for Panasonic manuals for everything they put their name on. They make great quality equipment and the world's worse operation manuals. The video format is different and initially difficult to work with in download and playback, but turns out to be a very good HD upgrade to the FZ18 Quicktime version.  Finding a lens hood for this camera is a problem. I did, but it does interfere in the span of the view of the lens which means cropping everything if I use it. The warranty requires that any backup battery you buy be "Panasonic". You can buy backup batteries. but nothing with Panasonic's name on it that I've found. I'm no Pro, so this camera will more than do anything I need a camera to do.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: Marsha Krady
Reviews.Content: Good camera.  As advertised. Light weight and easy to use. Focus is great and also easy to use by anyone.

Reviews.Title: Worth every penny!
Reviews.Author: Karen Mjartan
Reviews.Content: Love this camera so far! I have only had this a few days but so far I love all the features. Have a lot to read and study with this, but I am not at all disappointed with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Lumix is a great quality camera for the price!
Reviews.Author: Lorraine A. Ferry
Reviews.Content: I just love this camera.  It is not too big & bulky and it takes GREAT pictures.  I would recommend it to all...  This is my second "Lumix" camera ~ my other one was just the smaller point and shoot.  Panasonic has made a terrific product with these camera's.

Reviews.Title: traded in my fz28
Reviews.Author: RicknATL "RicknATL"
Reviews.Content: I traded in my fz28 to amazon and used the $92 gift card to buy the FZ60. Thus far, very impressed with this camera. Takes great pictures and is easy to use. It has a bit more zoom than the fz28 and a cmos sensor, with a direct video recording button. IMHO, well worth the extra $190 I paid to upgrade.

Reviews.Title: Good camera for the money
Reviews.Author: Lowcountry
Reviews.Content: I have had a Panasonic DMC -FZ 20 for several years and love it so it was natural to look at Panasonic for a present for my wife. The camera does a great job. My wife uses it most of the time in iA mode but has options to go manual as desired. The view finder is handy and not found on most cameras in the price range. The bottom line is great pictures, ease of use and right price.

Reviews.Title: This is a Grey Market Camera and is not warrantied!
Reviews.Author: David Marks "norcalidave"
Reviews.Content: Second update on August 20, 2013:I just found out that Photo Savings has an inventory of 20 MORE of these FZ60 cameras and I have to assume that ALL of them are grey market cameras, destined for South America, and with no Panasonic warranty at all, if bought in the U.S. This is absurd, and we all should ask the question, "Why is Amazon standing behind these sellers, who are selling cameras with no warranties, these products being essentially (as far as Panasonic is concerned) illegal cameras that are not supposed to be sold in the U.S." ? This seller only deserves ONE star, and Amazon itself deserves the same!------First update on August 19, 2013 to the original review (below):I received an email from Panasonic headquarters today, saying that this product had no English manual because it was manufactured for South America, and not for North America. Panasonic seems to be saying this is one of those "grey market" products, and they also say in their email that they will NOT warranty the camera at all!. The seller was "Photo Savings" and they seem to be highly rated on Amazon, but I can't give them more than three stars because they should have known the camera was not to be sold in the U.S. The way you can TELL if a Panasonic camera is valid for the U.S., is to look at the product code on the box the camera is in. If the code is "P", then it is a valid product, but if it is "PU" (which my camera was), then it is made for South America and its warranty will not be valid).  A "PC" denotation on the camera box means it is for Canada, by the way.-------------------Original Review:When I've used this camera more, I'll update this review.  I received it yesterday and there is NO paper manual (in English) included. The small manual that is included is only in Spanish and Portuguese and I would have to pay for an English manual (it costs $18 plus tax and shipping, from what I was told by the Panasonic Parts department)...There is a CD included, containing the manual in English, but even to download that, you need an owner's "password". I was finally able to get Panasonic to give me the correct website for downloading the English manual, but this is ridiculous....most people need a small paper manual to take with them when they're using a complex digital camera like this, and Panasonic does not provide one, or at least not for free!I own two other Panasonic digital cameras and they both came with a paper manual in addition with the CD manual.

Reviews.Title: Like it
Reviews.Author: Bubba
Reviews.Content: I had a Lumix previously and this is a replacement because it quit working after it got wet.  This camera has no shutter lag.  I get great pictures of my grandson smiling now instead of the back of his head.  The minor criticism I have is the size description.  They say it is 2.9 x 2.7 x 2.7 and it is so so wrong.  It is much closer to 5 x 4 x 4.

Reviews.Title: Good for a starter! (Like me!)
Reviews.Author: Drew
