Reviews.Content: I am 16 and working to start a YouTube channel up, and this is pretty good for a starting camera! It takes REALLY nice pictures and works amazingly! The only cons would be:- I can't attach an external microphone. (Or I haven't figured out how yet.)- It is difficult to connect it to an external monitor. You will need a Mini-HDMI-to-HDMI cord.- I don't think I can attach any new lenses. (Or, again, I haven't figured out how yet.)Other than that, it is awesome! Can't wait to start filming with my friends!

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Cindi Gliori
Reviews.Content: great camera, easy to use wonderful features and beautiful pictures. Would recommend to novice photographers.  My 15 year old daughter has has a blast using it.

Reviews.Title: So far...so good
Reviews.Author: Anthony
Reviews.Content: so far, it has been about what i expected.  Pretty good pictures from 6 to 8 feet with or without flash.  I have only used the automatic setting since that is what I want.  I have been pleased with the camera.

Reviews.Title: So Far, So Good
Reviews.Author: P. Mykytyn
Reviews.Content: I purchased the FZ60 just a few days ago after extensive research on this site as well as numerous others.  My intent was to purchase a point-and-shoot camera with an electronic viewfinder.  Unfortunately, much to my chagrin, it is extremely difficult to find such a camera today without spending $350+++.  I reviewed Panasonic, Canon, Fuji, and Olympus options before deciding on the FZ60.It is much too soon to render a complete review at this point.  All I can say is that the camera appears to be much better than my previous camera which was the Kodak Easyshare Z8612IS, a camera I purchased more than 5 years ago.  I have been through the user guide provided with the camera, although it is an abbreviated guide at best. The complete guide is available for download, which I did for my iPad.  It is one I will most likely review several times due to the extensive array of features offered by Panasonic.The one question I have at the moment concerns the flash function.  I spoke with a Panasonic customer service representative about this, as well as a couple of other points, but was still confused.  The representative seemed to imply that the pop-up flash must be open for the flash to function, even in the auto flash mode.  This seems counter intuitive to me.  I would think that the flash would automatically pop up from the closed position if the camera, both in the P and IA modes, deems the flash as necessary.  If this is not the case, I guess it means that I must always keep the pop-up flash open at all times, which again seems contradictory to an auto flash mode.  If someone has a thought on this or can clarify it for me, I would appreciate it.

Reviews.Title: Camera size
Reviews.Author: Howard
Reviews.Content: The camera was a lot larger then I really wanted,  its going to be a big change from going from the FZ 28 which I really thought was the greatest.

Reviews.Title: GREAT IDEA
Reviews.Author: Jack S. Schneider "snapshot"
Reviews.Content: Great idea  but I have found it difficult to read the instructions.  I have trouble formating the disks and getting rid of the images stored in the camera.  Instructions are confusing.  I could use help

Reviews.Title: PERFECT FOR OUR NEEDS
Reviews.Author: J. LaRose
Reviews.Content: THIS CAMERA WAS RECOMMENDED TO US.  WE ARE NOT VERY EXPERIENCED PHOTOGRAPHERS.  WE ARE LEARNING, THIS CAMERA IS SIMPLE AND TAKES GREAT PHOTOS.

Reviews.Title: Thus far  great results
Reviews.Author: ron thomas
Reviews.Content: Thus far I like the camera . I  am getting surprisingly blur free pictures with good color retention on  the high magnification settings. I am  impressed that auto mode I am able to catch a wide range  of motion and  depth of field. I wish that it  had  the capablity of a remote shutter release  and a lens hood but for my type photography  these aren't serious limitations. I do like the weight and size; feels like you are carrying a real camera. The editing system I downloaded  for the camera doesn't seem as simple to use as my old Kodak editing  system but it probably has more capabliites. I have  struggled  some to crop pictures but I bleieve this is due to my own slow learning curve as opposed to any problem with the system.

Reviews.Title: Best
Reviews.Author: mark osborne
Reviews.Content: Best camera I've ever owned. Takes phenomenal pictures with the greatest of ease.  I can't remember what negatives might have been in other reviews, but this camera was well worth the price at time of purchase and is very reliable.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Glenn L. Lee "Glenn"
Reviews.Content: This is the best small "point and shoot" camera I've ever owned.  The quality of the pictures, even at 25 zoom, is amazing.

Reviews.Title: Digital Camera with Zoom
Reviews.Author: Kathy McDonald
Reviews.Content: I'm not a professional photographer, but need quality photos for my work as well as my dog rescue.  This camera was recommended to me by two people that take professional photos saying it could do everything I need.

Reviews.Title: Purchase of Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ60
Reviews.Author: Dave Peterson
Reviews.Content: We just started using the camera and so far has meet all of our expectations.  We looked at the Nikon and Cannon and chose the Panasonic.  Camera arrived on time and as advertised.

Reviews.Title: almost as good as an SLR
Reviews.Author: bigL
Reviews.Content: The Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ60 is a great camera.  It is easy to use, and it's pictures are clear and can stops action.

Reviews.Title: I am happy.
Reviews.Author: L. Gonzalez
Reviews.Content: Since I received the item I started to take pictures those days and I am really happy to do that. The item is a very good make and has very good lens: LEICA.

Reviews.Title: Stop using your iphone and use a real camera!
Reviews.Author: Crispin Crispian "Crispin"
Reviews.Content: We thought it was about time that we stopped using our iphone as the default camera.  This camera is light and easy to use.  The photos are great - we've been very pleased with it so far.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: jack j. seng
Reviews.Content: Camera is great. Feature laden. Would have given it five stars if the camera's warranty would be honored in the United States.  The warranty that came with my camera is only good for Latin and South America! Gray market item. Just keep in mind that if something happens to this camera; Panasonic won't honor your warranty or service it.

Reviews.Title: Takes great pics!
Reviews.Author: David P. Unger
Reviews.Content: I've only had this camera for a few months but so far I'm very happy with it.  I generally use it on full automatic mode but have experimented with a few of the other settings.  I'm extremely happy with the crispness and clearness of my pictures.  The zoom feature has been extremely impressive.  I've managed to take pics of things very far away that I never really expected good results -- but I've been consistently surprised at how well they've turned out.  I've only used it twice for video recording and that seemed to come out just fine, too.  This camera has a lot of features and functions.....so much so that I find it a little overwhelming.  So reading through the user documentation is necessary.

Reviews.Title: Perfect bridge camera for a novice fotographer
Reviews.Author: Tonje Haugen
Reviews.Content: We wanted a camera that would take good pictures of our son who's 18 months. None of us are great photographers, or really into photography, so we wanted something that was easy to use. Well, we found it. This does just the job, has plenty of settings for us, and was very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: Very good camera
Reviews.Author: WCW1
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace another Lumix camera that failed due to a blurry lens problem. It is feature rich and can accommodate most photo opportunities. A little bulky but no to bad. I guess I got lucky and caught it on sale as the price is now higher, and that makes me even more satisfied.

Reviews.Title: great lens!
Reviews.Author: Vasoldar
Reviews.Content: i was a bit disapointed because it didnt come with any  memory card so i couldnt start to use it inmediatly!

Reviews.Title: Very nice Camera
Reviews.Author: "ronmar"
Reviews.Content: Great buy for the price. Many cameras with less features cost a lot more and don't perform as well. I'm still learning how to use but have been quite pleased this far.

Reviews.Title: Wonderfull!
Reviews.Author: Edumar Merchan
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. Excellent quality product, easy to use, perfect size, terrific photos. Many options to change picture styles.

Reviews.Title: PERFECT
Reviews.Author: LEANDRO DI MARIA
Reviews.Content: I love the zoom, the pictures colors, the video quality  and the light weight . Is an amazing camera my lumix

Reviews.Title: excellent feature set and ease-of-use
Reviews.Author: Leonard Soltzberg
Reviews.Content: This is an outstanding camera, especially at this price point. The 600mm-equivalent zoom lens provides unusual capability for a compact camera. The automatic mode quickly sets the various parameters depending on the subject; it even detects and sets up macro shots automatically. Flash is strong for a built-in unit. Manual controls are logically laid out.The high-definition video format does require using the Windows-only PhotofunStudio software (included with the camera) to transfer to video sequences to a DVD; a Mac version would be a welcome addition.

Reviews.Title: Very nice camera and a great value.
Reviews.Author: R. Williams
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with this camera.  Fantastic package of features at a very reasonable price.  Thank you to those of you who took to time to write detailed reviews on this camera.  I am so very please with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: P. Baker "SA RET"
Reviews.Content: I replaced my 5 year-old Lumix with this one and I'm loving it, too!  Great zoom!  My older Lumix was an 18x zoom so I'm loving the increased capibility!

Reviews.Title: Wow
Reviews.Author: J Kirkland
Reviews.Content: Well...it's my first point and shoot and I'm really impressed with it. Excellent shots, and I've found it perfect for travel.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ60K 16.1 MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: George J. Biehl "GEOMILO"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this as a gift for our daughter who has 4 very active kids. She has been using it for various athletic and social events and has been very happy with the photos it takes.The zoom lens is great for hockey and soccer games.

Reviews.Title: What else can you buy?
Reviews.Author: laago
Reviews.Content: UPDATED 2/10/2012I own this camera & after a nightmare trying to get the printable manual (see below) the jury is still out.I agree with the other reviewer/writer it has excellent features, too many without a manual to hand, also too many menus.Without actually looking at the rear buttons before shooting it is easy to hit the wrong one/button during use, especially the AF/AF closeup/MF button, sometimes I manage to touch one by mistake in use & I don't have an enormous thumb! The red movie button on the top seems eratic both beginning & stopping a movie, sometimes does not work for me so I prefer to use the main dial for movie mode, also the on/off lever feels as if 1 day it will snap!Since writing the above I have definitely found the buttons on the back a problem, touching them without trying, & the design of the body with a space for your thumb.........you need deformed hands to use it, that's probably why I touch the buttons accidentally, the auto focus does not focus on the object always, sometimes on something in front of it to the side instead, I've tried changing the focus modes to no avail.OTHER GRIPES...............NO MOVABLE SCREEN, also the lens cover..............problems getting off & on!The zoom lens works well in low light, & now have made good movies & shot reasonable photos in Auto mode. The stills are OK but I expected more, especially using the Zoom the camera does not auto-focus well in my opinion. Another big gripe as has been stated in all reviews is the lack of any extended time mode. I used to like shooting the night sky, also movement of speed shots, not possible at all.I have owned 2 Olympus cameras previously & both were better thought out body-wise, also allowed night shots etc.I did think about sending it back but shall continue in my quest for excellence because what else is available?So to sum up..........GOODValue for money & features compared with competitors, I spent days researching them all.Has a viewfinder.Some/most photos are good.Movies.Battery life.BADStills focusing. On one menu option it has various so-called focus points outlined together, who wants that, I just want to focus on the main object?If I could I would post examples but not sure you can with comments?No extended exposure.Instructions.UGLYBody design & button placement.Panasonic website/sites, although they do respond quickly.THIS WAS MY 1ST COMMENT! Panasonic have changed their website since!?I received the camera OK but there is no manual.I went to Panasonic.eu, downloaded the manual, printed it.............over 200 pages only to find the downloaded FZ62 manual had different functions to the actual camera received. So I went back to Panasonic, registered it as OTHER because there is not a FZ62 showing then looked for another manual. I found a manual with the FZ62 I had but it also has the FZ200 which means spending ages separating the pages because they are not separate but mixed together.I decided to complain to Panasonic............on the form for contacting Panasonic Customer Services.eu they only have USA States so I had to choose WYOMING to get it sent!The manual problem is scandelous, BE WARNED IN ADVANCE you only receive a very basic paper instruction leaflet included with the camera.

Reviews.Title: Excellent value
Reviews.Author: Blondie
Reviews.Content: A professional photographer recommended this camera. For the money it is an EXCELLENT value. Many features you expect in a higher end camera. Easy to use controls. Photo quality is excellent even at long range. VERY pleased with it. And did I mention EXCELLENT VALUE,

Reviews.Title: Fantastic camera
Reviews.Author: Ronald M.
Reviews.Content: The constant aperture on this camera with the 600mm zoom gave me the ability to capture closeup wildlife shots in Alaska that I never thought possible on my budget for a camera.  Absolutely fantastic camera.  The only negative is the full manual is on a disc and to print it out is over 200 pages.  However, I read the basics of what I wanted to do before my trip and was able to do all the things I was looking to do without having the manual with me.  People on the trip with their expensive and heavy cameras with the long lenses were astonished at the photos I captured.Thank you Panasonic.

Reviews.Title: Lumix
Reviews.Author: Allan Hawkins V
Reviews.Content: I'm a Lumix fan, and this FZ60 is just outstanding! Powerfull zoom and powerfull image stabilization. Outstanding pictures. I love it!!12-09-2013Change my rate to one star, but true is minus that. Less than two months of ocassionaly use and good care with the camera, I got a dust inside the lens. If you read all my previuos reviews you'll see that's a common problem with Lumix lenses. The point is, this is what I paid for? This camera is a waste fo time and money.

Reviews.Title: Wasn't ready to write this until now
Reviews.Author: Pennsylvania Frank "Just a Christmas shopper"
Reviews.Content: Really, I shouldn't write the review even now, because I still haven't had time to learn more than a handful of this camera's tricks, but I took it to two race tracks last weekend, and the camera performed spectacularly (until it got really dark, when it just doesn't let in enough light). The pix were as good as nearly anything I've ever shot in motorsports, and that's been a long time.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Jamie Williamson
Reviews.Content: This camera is amazing.  I was looking for a light weight, easy to use camera for an upcoming trip to Europe, but quality of images and videos were equally important. I did my research and pretty much everyone recommended this camera.  It is very easy to use and the images look professional!

Reviews.Title: great zoom!
Reviews.Author: Bronx
Reviews.Content: Light weight, great lens,an all around camera at a great price!Easy zoom to use and you can use the viewfinder instead of the screen.

Reviews.Title: Best value for your money - could be better than DMC-FZ47
Reviews.Author: Sam
Reviews.Content: This is the successor to last year's DMC-FZ47 which is also highly rated. Please go to this link for a detailed review. This camera is the same as DMC-FZ62 sold in Europe and AustraliaWhatdigitalcamera.comAlthough the review did not mention anything about the low light capability, I gathered by looking at the Panasonic catalog that the sensitivity will be as good as if not better than the DMC-ZS15. Neither did the review compare this camera with last year's DMC-FZ47 but with a new 16 megapixel sensor and a new Venus processor, the image quality and noise reduction should be better (except at higher ISO). I had the DMC-FZ47 for a short time last year before I sold it to friend and I thought it was a good camera except for the noise and a mediocre low light performance - doesn't everybody wants to take pictures without using the flash.Performance wise, this is definitely not as good as the DMC-FZ200, but for those on a budget you definitely get your moneys worth.I'll update my comment and probably my rating to 5 stars as I find more reviews.8/27 Update:Cameralabs.com just did a detailed review (so did Photographyblog.com). Although the unit tested is a pre production model with a firmware version 0.20 (actual production model incorporates firmware version 1.00). Test shows it produces great quality images and exhibits a pleasingly natural tonal range and guess what - it excels in low light, but lags behind DMC-FZ47 in continuous or burst shooting. Maximum continuous shooting speed only works for three shots which is just fine for my own needs. Cameralabs.com & Photographyblog.com gave it a "Recommended" rating.I'm not a professional photographer so based on my own personal needs and the price of $349. which will eventually go down, I think this camera is one of the lowest value for your money. Otherwise if you need a high performing camera then go with the DMC-FZ200 which sells for $600.

Reviews.Title: so far SO GOOD!
Reviews.Author: bobby van
Reviews.Content: i have been reasonably satisfied with this camera; photos could be better; maybe i just need to see how to use it more effectively!

Reviews.Title: Truly NOT a pocket camera
Reviews.Author: Janet G
Reviews.Content: Return was a thirty-minute decision.Wanted a replacement for my trusty Canon power shot (which died after 10 great years when I dropped it during a battery charge) and was scared off by reviews that new Canons are slow.Though the dimensions should have resonated, I didn't realize until I held the Lumix  that it is NOT a camera I can put in my bag and whip out when the perfect moment happens.  It is big -- too big even for a day pack, much less a handbag.  Moreover, it doesn't come with that nice little leather case the Canon was packaged in, so the big camera has to go in an even bigger case. Given what I read about Panasonic warranties and the flimsy lens cover, going without a case seems very risky. Seems like it would require two hands to hold and operate, and I'm frequently shooting with just one free hand.  Realized just the size was going to keep me from taking most of the impromptu shots I take of grandchildren or on vacations.Yes, I could zoom across my backyard and get a fabulous close up of a new robin's nest, but how often would I do that?It does not come with a memory card, so be sure you have one when it arrives and you want to try it out.  The battery charger they include requires their (provided) cable.  If you are like me with way too many cables in your life, this was a negative. My old Canon charger plugged right in to any outlet.Here's the really odd thing:  the tiny operating instruction booklet was in Spanish.  The language in the camera itself was Spanish.  Nice this option exists, but no one told me I needed to select a language.

Reviews.Title: I don't like
Reviews.Author: Kat Silva
Reviews.Content: I think this is a personal thing.  I got this camera and just don't like the way it is in my hands.  I have small hands so think it is really just a personal preference.

Reviews.Title: Too big and bulky
Reviews.Author: Kevin D.
Reviews.Content: I returned it right away. I wanted a more 'grab & go, point & shoot' camera. It was big & bulky and I do have a SLR camera for big 'jobs'.
